channel.title: THE READY CEE SHOW
channel.description: For 8 years THE READY CEE SHOW Dominated The New York City airwaves every Saturday night on 91.9FM. Now we bring you the online version! Subscribe today for FREE and every week you'll receive a new episode of THE READY CEE SHOW! REAL HIP-HOP, NOT THAT CRAP ON THE RADIO!
channel.itunes:subtitle: www.thereadyceeshow.com
channel.itunes:author: DJ Ready Cee
channel.itunes:summary: For 8 years THE READY CEE SHOW Dominated The New York City airwaves every Saturday night on 91.9FM. Now we bring you the online version! Subscribe today for FREE and every week you'll receive a new episode of THE READY CEE SHOW! REAL HIP-HOP, NOT THAT CRAP ON THE RADIO!

item.title: THE READY CEE SHOW - EPISODE #179
item.description: If you listen to The Ready Cee Show you represent the last part of Hiphop's living generation. It means you don't fall for the bullshit and at the same time you don't appreciate it being pushed in your face and misrepresenting the culture that you, for so many years, helped to create. In our continued tradition of bringing you nothing less than the most authentic flavor in existence, this week we welcome special guest, D STRONG to the lab all the way from Los Angeles. We've been rockin a few D Strong joints in the weeks leading up to this episode to get you prepped for his appearance and now its here. D Strong recently released his newest LP, 'Rise & Shoot' and he's here to let us know about his legacy and his plans for furthering Hiphop as a whole.

item.title: THE READY CEE SHOW - EPISODE #178
item.description: Most so-called Hiphop DJs around the world don't have the balls to play real music. Most don't even know the difference between the authentic flavor and the phony plastic stuff. You've made the right choice by choosing THE READY CEE SHOW for your listening enjoyment! This week we return with all brand new music from some of the most important figures in Hiphop today. We've got some special announcements for our New York City listeners this week so be sure to download and spread the links to all who deserve it! Take a quick second to share a link to The Ready Cee Show on your Facebook, Twitter or other social network! http://thereadyceeshow.com And subscribe for FREE to The Ready Cee Show on iTunes here: itpc://thereadyceeshow.podOmatic.com/rss2.xml Follow @djreadycee @streetvisionNYC

item.title: THE READY CEE SHOW - EPISODE #177
item.description: It's Friday the 13th and today is bad luck for all you sucka ass DJs out there because DJ Ready Cee & DJ Mixx have returned once again to slash the wack in half like Jason Voorhees! We're hoarding loads of new rap this week from favorites like Gangrene, Planet Asia, D-Strong and more! Set your weekend off the right way and download these raw beats right now!

item.title: THE READY CEE SHOW - EPISODE #176
item.description: We're right back at you this week with another brand-new journey for your ears! DJ Ready Cee and DJ Mixx are Hiphop's last DJs and we have more ammo than ever in the clip! This week we switch up the flow and welcome special guest SHABAAM SAHDEEQ to the show!! The Brooklyn native emcee made his way up to the Boogie Down Bronx for a long overdue visit! We build with the brotha about his legacy, passion for emceeing and upcoming projects! Make sure you spread the link around the world and share this flavor with everyone who deserves to hear it! Visit the new http://readymadeflow.blogspot.com

item.title: THE READY CEE SHOW - EPISODE #175
item.description: I'm short on words this week. Just download the new episode and get ready to rip through your streets with pure fire. I don't have to explain how me and DJ Mixx get down, you already know how we do! RAW SHIT FOR YOUR SYSTEM! DIRECTLY FROM THE BOOGIE DOWN BRONX STRAIGHT TO YOU!

item.title: THE READY CEE SHOW - EPISODE #174
item.description: This week's episode is like the final bullet that kills any radio left alive on the planet. It's the bullet that murders every so called underground Hiphop show out there pullin fraud moves behind a digital curtain! We've got all new joints this week spun by none other than DJ Ready Cee & DJ Mixx! Biggup to everyone who tuned in and caught us last week on 89.1FM in NYC on The Halftime Radio Show with Kool Herc & Friends! Take a quick second to share a link to The Ready Cee Show on your Facebook, Twitter or other social network! http://thereadyceeshow.com And subscribe for FREE to The Ready Cee Show on iTunes here: itpc://thereadyceeshow.podOmatic.com/rss2.xml Follow @djreadycee @streetvisionNYC

item.title: THE READY CEE SHOW - EPISODE #173
item.description: First episode of 2012 and we have a gang of joints to get on and info to get out! Listen out this week for new music from Homeboy Sandman, KRS-One, Bumpy Knuckles and many more! DJ Ready Cee & DJ Mixx are going back-and-forth every three joints this week and keepin it movin! SPECIAL ANNOUNCEMENT: This WEDNESDAY, FEBRUARY 1st DJ READY CEE & DJ MIXX will take over the duties of the world-famous HALFTIME RADIO SHOW on 89.1FM WNYU radio in NYC! DJ Eclipse, DJ Skizz & Petey Cologne are heading out on tour with La Coka Nostra and have called upon NYC's underground generals to take over the on-air duties while they're out! It's gonna be epic as we welcome special guests, BARBURY'N (Milano, D-Flow, Gage) & EL GANT to the broadcast along with Live-N-Direct's, PETER OASIS who will have tickets to give away for the HIT SQUAD REUNION CONCERT at The Best Buy Theatre in Times Square on February 24th!! Tune in live at 10:30pm EST on 89.1FM in NYC or log on from wherever you are at http://www.wnyu.org

item.title: DJ MIXX & DJ READY CEE - DRUNK UNC CLASSICS
item.description: LEAVE A COMMENT BELOW!!! We're taking it WAY back this week. Everyone's been waiting for DJ Ready Cee & DJ Mixx to drop a soul & funk classics mix for a long time and they finally got together, cracked the Maker's Mark and rewound that shit to a time before you had to know Windows to be a DJ! Break this mix out at your family's holiday gathering and watch as your old relatives slowly ease into the Spanky involuntarily and without even noticing. DJ Mixx sets off the first half hour and DJ Ready Cee bring it home to make a full hour of straight classics to bring the soul back to the holiday season! This is strictly for the OGs!! JAMES BROWN!!
item.dc:creator: DJ Ready Cee
item.itunes:summary:

Break this mix out at your family's holiday gathering and watch as your old relatives slowly ease into the Spanky involuntarily and without even noticing. This is strictly for the OGs!!
JAMES BROWN!!

item.title: STREET VISION TV (Episode 1) Featuring SADAT X & AG
item.description: BRONX, NEW YORK CITY -- Lyrical legends Sadat X (Brand Nubian) and AG (DITC) recently rolled through the Street Vision Radio studio to chop it up with DJ Ready Cee & DJ Mixx. As the night progressed things turned up as the duo began to spit raw freestyles over live beats provided by DJ Ready Cee on the 1s & 2s which resulted in an impromptu edition of Sadat X's, True Wine Connoisseur series. Be on the look out for the collaborative LP from Sadat X & AG, TRINITY coming soon on Fat Beats Records. IF YOU'RE FEELIN THIS REAL HIPHOP PLEASE LEAVE A COMMENT AND SHARE THE LINK! Enjoy past episodes of READY CEE TV: RCTVe3 http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iZjojfraYuU RCTVe4 http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wXnfvx_LGSI&feature=related RCTVe5 http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JHMYlyzxBos&feature=related

item.title: (CLASSIC MIXTAPE SERIES) DJ Ready Cee & DJ Mixx - THE SANDHOGS (2005)
item.description: I've decided to let loose a series of classic mixtapes myself and DJ Mixx have dropped throughout the time. There's so many to choose from. These CDs spread world wide but naturally saw the most light here in the streets of NYC. So to get the flavor into the hands of some who might not have been able to catch it, we're going to release a bunch of em into the netwaves for your enjoyment. First off is THE SANDHOGS. This is one of the first mixtapes that Me and DJ Mixx did together back in 2005. This was right after we left 91.9FM and took all of our forces into the mixtape scene so we were pretty heavy on the blocks at this time. Fat Beats record store saw these fly off the shelves every day and it even went on to catch the attention of some unmentionable eyes that caused us to rework the cover art because of some copyright issues. Sandhog is the slang term given to urban miners or construction workers who work underground on a variety of excavation projects in New York City. Me & Mixx handle our mining and construction projects in the underground as well so it was a fitting term. 01. Intro 02. Prodigy & Illa Gee - Comatose State 03. Illa Gee - Dot The I 04. Platinum Pied Pipers feat. Jay Dee - Act Like You Know 05. Redman & Busta Rhymes - Do The Damn Thing 06. Smif-N-Wesson feat. Heltah Skeltah - Timbs Do Work 07. Alkoholiks - Flute Song 08. Sheek Louch - Street Music 09. Saigon - I'm Gone 10. GZA & DJ Muggs - Unstoppable Threats 11. Canibus & Kurupt - Not 4 Play 12. MF DOOM & Talib Kweli - Old School 13. Planet Asia - Medicine 14. Rah Digga feat. Chauncey Black & Busta Rhymes - You Already Know 15. Ol' Dirty Bastard & Busta Rhymes - Where's Your Money 16. Buckshot & 9th Wonder - Slippin' 17. The Emcee (Jin) - Who's The Best? 18. Sadat X - God Is Back In Town 19. Teflon & DJ Premier - Showtime 20. A.G. feat. Party Arty & Madlib - Take A Ride 21. Supernatural - 1-2 Punch 22. Kool G. Rap - How The Players Play 23. Royal Flush & M.O.P. - Worldwide Pt. 2 24. AZ feat. Ghostface & Raekwon - New York, New York 25. Kev Brown feat. Phonte & Oddisee - Beats & Rhymes 26. Kev Brown feat. Cy Young - Keep On 27. Necro - Piss Feel free to spread the download/stream links! Follow @djreadycee @djmixx2011 @streetvisionnyc Visit djreadycee.com streetvisionradio.com

Canibus & Kurupt - Not 4 Play 12. MF DOOM & Talib Kweli - Old School 13. Planet Asia - Medicine 14. Rah Digga feat. Chauncey Black & Busta Rhymes - You Already Know 15. Ol' Dirty Bastard & Busta Rhymes - Where's Your Money 16. Buckshot & 9th Wonder - Slippin' 17. The Emcee (Jin) - Who's The Best? 18. Sadat X - God Is Back In Town 19. Teflon & DJ Premier - Showtime 20. A.G. feat. Party Arty & Madlib - Take A Ride 21. Supernatural - 1-2 Punch 22. Kool G. Rap - How The Players Play 23. Royal Flush & M.O.P. - Worldwide Pt. 2 24. AZ feat. Ghostface & Raekwon - New York, New York 25. Kev Brown feat. Phonte & Oddisee - Beats & Rhymes 26. Kev Brown feat. Cy Young - Keep On 27. Necro - Piss
Feel free to spread the download/stream links!

item.title: THE READY CEE SHOW - EPISODE #172
item.description: Ok enough with the old school, we're back in your face this week with the brand new shit you've been waiting for. We're impacting the netwaves this week with new music from Hiphop's last generation of special forces! DJ Ready Cee & DJ Mixx are back up on the block with more than an hour of all raw neck-snappers! Throw your radio in the garbage where it belongs and get back up to date with some Hiphop that you don't have to be embarrassed to listen to! Don't be fooled by these fly-by-night shows & podcasts you see sneakin up here and there around the net, anyone can act like a pro until the sound hits the speaker! But by then you've wasted valuable time and bandwidth! So just cut out all that bullshit, stick to this real shit and tell a friend! Be on the look out this week for the premier of the brand new STREET VISION TV featuring all new episodes straight from the vaults of The Ready Cee Show, Live-N-Direct, The Chronicles and all our other outlets! Street Vision TV http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9G96mdWCqW0

item.title: THE READY CEE SHOW - EPISODE #171 (SOUP KITCHEN INVASION)
item.description: We're back in time for the holiday week with another ridiculous mix for your Thanksgiving soundtrack! The Ready Cee Show is for the people, so we gathered up a few pots of funk and brought em over to The Soup Kitchen!! That's right this week we have an exclusive mix from Apollo Treed & The Soup Kitchen crew and together we're "Feedin The Needy" with a Hip-Hop Marvel Team-Up! Bump this shit while Moms is hookin up that giblet gravy & sweet potato pie in the kitchen! Bump this shit so your half paralyzed uncle can start dancing in the living room! Bump this shit to distract the family so you can slide off and hit that L right quick! Spread the links this week and share this food with all the impoverished, needy Hiphop refugees you know!

item.title: Five Steez & DJ Ready Cee - THE MOMENTUM Vol. 2
item.description: KINGSTON, JAMAICA – Rising Hip Hop artiste, Five Steez, and New York City radio icon, DJ Ready Cee, have released the highly anticipated ‘Momentum: Volume Two’ mixtape for free download and streaming at http://www.djreadycee.com & iTunes. The 35-minute mix by DJ Ready Cee is also available as a single-track and as 17 separate tracks at the Five Steez Facebook Fan Page (http://www.facebook.com/fivesteez). ‘Volume One’ in the three-part series, released December 2010, clocked tens of thousands of downloads within months of its release. “I took it back to the ‘golden era’ with the choice of instrumentals on the last one and now we’ve moved up in time. It’s the same concept but the energy is crazier plus there are new flows and new styles. I had to top the first one with this. That’s the whole idea of building momentum,” says the young Kingston-based rapper. Despite widespread local and international awareness of an emerging Hip Hop scene in the land of Reggae, Five Steez has captured the attention of numerous tastemakers in Hip Hop including the legendary DJ Ready Cee. “I’m telling you, whoever felt Volume One is gonna love Volume Two. It’s exactly the same vibe and sounds like a perfect continuation. I know it took a long while but I just had to wait for the right time,” says DJ Ready Cee.
item.dc:creator: DJ Ready Cee
item.itunes:summary:
KINGSTON, JAMAICA – Rising Hip Hop artiste, Five Steez, and New York City radio icon, DJ Ready Cee, have released the highly anticipated ‘Momentum: Volume Two’ mixtape for free download and streaming at http://www.djreadycee.com & iTunes. The 35-minute mix by DJ Ready Cee is also available as a single-track and as 17 separate tracks at the Five Steez Facebook Fan Page (http://www.facebook.com/fivesteez).
‘Volume One’ in the three-part series, released December 2010, clocked tens of thousands of downloads within months of its release.
“I took it back to the ‘golden era’ with the choice of instrumentals on the last one and now we’ve moved up in time. It’s the same concept but the energy is crazier plus there are new flows and new styles. I had to top the first one with this. That’s the whole idea of building momentum,” says the young Kingston-based rapper.
Despite widespread local and international awareness of an emerging Hip Hop scene in the land of Reggae, Five Steez has captured the attention of numerous tastemakers in Hip Hop including the legendary DJ Ready Cee.
“I’m telling you, whoever felt Volume One is gonna love Volume Two. It’s exactly the same vibe and sounds like a perfect continuation. I know it took a long while but I just had to wait for the right time,” says DJ Ready Cee.

item.title: THE READY CEE SHOW - EPISODE #170
item.description: EVERY TEN EPISODES since we started the podcast we rock strictly classic joints blended up and mixed like only DJ Ready Cee & DJ Mixx can... The tradition continues this week with Episode #170! Be sure to spread these links all across the world and get the word out about Hiphop's illest podcast! Leave a comment here right below and let us know what you think about the show! We need that feedback!

item.title: THE READY CEE SHOW - EPISODE #169
item.description: We come from a generation of Hiphop that stood strong for itself and wasn't weighted down by the forces of greed and genocide. The rules we set in place for the new form of communication we created have been turned against us and are being used to dissolve the very foundation that gave it birth. They're meticulously dividing us into very separate groups who don't agree with one anothers ways and soon we'll be involved in a highly orchestrated civil war that will eventually destroy every drip of soul that ever existed. That's why programs like THE READY CEE SHOW are so important, because it represents the true COUNTER CULTURE that Hiphop is. Its not a puppet being controlled by the interests of screaming teenage girls or wide-eyed envious dudes with no flavor. Its one of the last remaining SOURCES of raw energy that keeps Hiphop powered and alive. This week, DJ Mixx sets off the journey with a fiercely blended mix of classic bangers to heat your soul to an appropriate temperature to handle the raw BRAND NEW joints that DJ Ready Cee spins for the second half of the show! Keep spreading these links around to every corner of the internet and help infect the ears of these zombies out here and try to bring em back to life!

item.title: THE READY CEE SHOW ONLINE 6 YEAR ANNIVERSARY REUP - EPISODE ONE!
item.description: Today marks 6 years since we moved THE READY CEE SHOW from the airwaves of 91.9FM in New York City to the worldwide broadcast of the internet. To celebrate, we've dug up the very first online episode of the show for you to check out! We dropped this episode on August 29th, 2005 and 167 episodes later we're still bringing you the illest joints the world of Hiphop has to offer! Thanks for the continued support of all our listeners world-wide!

Thanks for the continued support of all our listeners world-wide!

item.title: THE READY CEE SHOW - EPISODE #167
item.description: Strange weather patterns are happening in NYC right now and its all because of the fierce mixing going on up in The Bronx with DJ Ready Cee & DJ Mixx! That wasn't an earthquake this week, it was my sub woofer gettin it in! ALL NEW joints this week from Hiphop's elite including CHINO XL, The Brown Bag Allstars, Slaine, Torae & more! Special shouts out to all our listeners worldwide! Keep showing support and spread the links around to everyone you know who needs this real shit in their lives!

item.title: THE READY CEE SHOW - EPISODE #162
item.description: THE READY CEE SHOW - EPISODE #162 Huge update today with a brand new full hour of flavor from Hiphop's last DJs, DJ Ready Cee & DJ Mixx! Stop listening to embarrassing so-called DJs who have NO SKILLS on the 1s & 2s! Stop blaming Hiphop for being dead when its you who stopped paying attention to the real shit! Let's get the word out this week and let the people know we got brand new joints from Nas, Kev Brown, Large Professor, Brown Bag AllStars and many more! UPCOMING EVENTS: DJ Ready Cee performing with EL GANT: 3rd Annual Beat*Shot Music Festival For list of performances go here: http://ghoulpoon.com/2011/06/08/3rd-annual-beatshot-music-festival/ Friday, July 1-3, 2011 Albany, NY DJ Ready Cee performing with EL GANT & BEKAY: The Closers Born Day Bash Permormances by: Ruste Juxx, Blaq Poet, The Closers, Bekay & El Gant, Nine, Cella Dwellas, Meyhem Lauren, Singapore Kane (Boston), M-Dot (Boston), cRITICAL, Virtuoso (Boston), B.E.Z./Bezerk, G Huff (Ohio) Friday, July 15 @Tammany Hall, NYC DJ Ready Cee B-DAY BASH July 30, 2011 Location & Info TBA Follow us: @djreadycee @djmixx2011 streetvisionnyc

item.title: THE READY CEE SHOW - EPISODE #161
item.description: We're flowin straight from the survival scrolls this week with brand new heat from Hiphop's elite! The Ready Cee Show is back in full swing bringing you the rawest beats in the world on a weekly basis! New joints this week from Random Axe, Trinity, Kool G. Rap, Vast Aire and many more! The crates are overflowing with new flavor so we're gonna try to get as much in this week as we can! DJ Ready Cee & DJ Mixx once again set off over an hour of future classics off of the 4 turntable mega-lab in the Bronx! Look for a new episode of The Ready Cee Show podcast on Mondays along with our LIVE SHOW every Monday night at 8pm on http://StreetVisionRadio.com! THAT'S RIGHT... In case you didn't know, DJ Ready Cee & DJ Mixx spin LIVE ONLINE every Monday night! That means TONIGHT you can log on from where ever you are and check out your favorite DJs LIVE on the set with STREET VISION TV! Spread the word and don't forget to watch tonight at 8pm EST! http://StreetVisionRadio.com Follow us: @djreadycee @djmixx2011 @streetvisionnyc
item.dc:creator: DJ Ready Cee

item.title: THE READY CEE SHOW - EPISODE #160
item.description: DJ Ready Cee & DJ Mixx are back with Episode #160 of The Ready Cee Show! You know how it goes down every tenth episode, we bring nothing but the rawest classics blended up and mixed stronger than the most potent Nutcracker you can find in the streets of the Bronx! This FOUR TURNTABLE MEGA-MIX marks the return of the weekly episodes for your listening enjoyment! We've built a new stockpile of weaponry and the BX Strikeforce is ready to smash through the grills of these weak phony DJs who've been flooding your inboxes with bullshit mixes and fake bitch-made shows where the computer does most of the work!

We've built a new stockpile of weaponry and the BX Strikeforce is ready to smash through the grills of these weak phony DJs who've been flooding your inboxes with bullshit mixes and fake bitch-made shows where the computer does most of the work!

item.title: DJ Ready Cee - ENCEPHALOMYELITIS (Official Video)
item.description: DJ Ready Cee arrives with the first video experience off of ‘THE INCREDIBLE CASEY JONES’ Beat Tape dropping any day now! COVER: http://thereadyceeshow.spithate.com/2011/05/09/dj-ready-cee-the-incredible-casey-jones-instrumental-ep/ MAKE NO MISTAKE!! THE READY CEE SHOW PODCAST IS STILL HERE AND WILL RETURN TO REGULAR SCHEDULED PROGRAMMING STARTING WITH EPISODE #160 COMING YOUR WAY ANY DAY NOW!!! Follow @djreadycee @streetvisionnyc @oldschoolhiphop Visit http://djreadycee.com
item.dc:creator: DJ Ready Cee

item.title: DJ READY CEE & DJ MIXX present: JUSTO'S REVOLUTION PT. 2 (Hosted by Pete Rock & Marley Marl)
item.description: Mixtapes come a dime a dozen in today's world of MP3s and computerized DJing. Thousands of DJs were born out of nowhere with the emergence of new technology and spawned a rash of low brow releases that have flooded the streets from coast to coast. JUSTO'S REVOLUTION PT. 2 represents what makes a mixtape stand out above the crowd. It represents a true collaborative effort between some of Hiphop's legends and it's emerging forces. Artists like Pete Rock, DJ Premier and Black Sheep have come together with DJ Ready Cee & DJ Mixx to honor a man who meant so much to the world of mixtape DJing, Justo Faison. We called on some of our most powerful allies in the world of Hiphop to contribute to this project and everyone we needed stepped up in a big way to make this happen. JUSTO'S REVOLUTION PT. 2 reaches far beyond the expectations of a normal mixtape and brings heavyweights back to the roots of the game! 01. INTRO feat. MARLEY MARL & PETE ROCK 02. JUSTO DJ SHOUT 03. FALLEN SOLDIERS PT. 1 feat. 2PAC, BIGGIE SMALLS, BIG L & BIG PUN 04. THE CAMPAIGN feat. RAS KASS prod. by REROC 05. BRING YALL BACK - PETE ROCK feat. LITTLE BROTHER 06. SHOUTS OUT (INTERLUDE) 07. J DILLA SPEAKS 08. DEDICATION feat. EL GANT 09. ROAD TRIP feat. EL GANT & J BLANC 10. TITANIC SPEAKS 11. ANGELS feat. GHOSTFACE & DOOM 12. JUSTO SPEAKS 13. NEXT UP feat. BIG DADDY KANE, KOOL G. RAP & UGK 14. LIVE FROM THE BX FREESTYLE feat. TRIFE DA GOD & TOMMY WHISPERS 15. GREW UP HARD feat. TRIFE DA GOD & SOLOMON CHILDS 16. DJ PREMIER SPEAKS 17. LIVE FROM LONG BEACH FREESTYLE feat. PERCEE P & AC THE PROGRAM DIRECTOR 18. JUSTO TRIBUTE feat. DOO-WOP 19. DJ KHALED SPEAKS 20. DEDICATION feat. PAPOOSE 21. LIVE FROM THE BX FREESTYLE feat. DRES OF BLACK SHEEP 22. GREW UP feat. BLACK SHEEP 23. FIGHT NIGHT 2002 feat. WORLD 24. DON’T BE MAD feat. PETE ROCK 25. LIVE FROM THE BX FREESTYLE feat. EDO G, JAYSAUN, SLAINE & DJ JAYCEEOH (SPECIAL TEAMZ) 26. FALLEN SOLDIERS PT. 2 feat. PROOF, PROFESSOR X & OL’ DIRTY BASTARD 27. THE PJ’S (REMIX) feat. RAEKWON 28. JUSTO TRIBUTE feat. DA RANJAHZ 29. RAZAH RUBIES FREESTYLE feat. HELL RAZAH of SUNZ OF MAN 30. JUSTO/JAM MASTER JAY TRIBUTE 31. RIP JUSTO feat. THE CO. 32. OUTRO feat. MARLEY MARL & PETE ROCK Mixed & Arranged by: DJ Ready Cee & DJ Mixx for Street Vision Media Special Thanks: The Legacy of Justo Faison (RIP...your vision continues!), Sommer & Titanic (Jus Muzik Group), Devin & Will (Nature Sounds Records), Marley Marl & Pete Rock for holdin it down with the hosting--good lookin!, Ras Kass, KL(Screwball) Rest In Peace!, Fat Beats Record Store, Trife Da God, Tommy Whispers (TMF/Theodore Unit), Dres of Black Sheep, Edo G, Jaysaun, Slaine, Panther Productions, DJ Jayceeoh, Hell Razah, DJ Khaled, DJ Premier, Jazz & The U.N., The Co., Percee P, El Gant & Blanco (Nacirema), all TRUE mixtape DJ’s world-wide!

item.title: DJ Ready Cee & Five Steez - THE MOMENTUM Vol. 1
item.description: Kingston, Jamaica: LOCAL RAPPER RELEASES MIXTAPE WITH HIP HOP ICON In 1967, Jamaican-born DJ Kool Herc took the local sound system culture to the Bronx, New York and subsequently, Hip Hop was born. Four decades later, the genre has come full circle as Five Steez, one of Jamaica’s Hip Hop MCs, has collaborated with DJ Ready Cee, a New York underground Hip Hop radio icon from the Bronx, and released a mixtape online entitled ‘The Momentum: Volume One’. The mixtape, which is the first release in a three part series, features 18 tracks, spanning a total of 46 minutes, in which Five Steez spits his lyrics over well-known instrumentals as DJ Ready Cee employs his tricks in mixing, cutting and scratching. It is available for download at www.djreadycee.com, www.facebook.com/fivesteez & iTunes. “It’s been a while since I’ve heard a ‘real mixtape’ with actual mixing, plus scratching, and I wanted to bring that back,” says the rapper. “It’s become rare even within modern Hip Hop but this is what the mixtape is really about.” DJ Ready Cee, known for The Underground Lockdown and The Ready Cee Show on New York City’s WHUT 91.9FM during the late 1990s and early 2000s, says, “I first heard the homie Five Steez when he sent me a track that I played on my online show. I was blown away and so were my co-hosts and listeners because it was so dope. And this kid is coming straight out of Kingston, Jamaica, so that was special.” Five Steez says, “Ready Cee is an icon so it’s definitely an honour to get this type of support from him, particularly with the mixtape. I hope that this will highlight turntablism locally and also build my fanbase, especially abroad where the real market for Hip Hop exists.” Five Steez is one of the most recognized artists within Kingston’s growing Hip Hop movement and is best known for his appearance in the music video, ‘Get Down’, and recent performances at Manifesto|Jamaica events, ART’ical Exposure and ART’ical Empowerment Live. He can be found at www.twitter.com/fivesteez (@FiveSteez) and www.facebook.com/fivesteez
item.dc:creator: DJ Ready Cee
item.itunes:summary:
Kingston, Jamaica: LOCAL RAPPER RELEASES MIXTAPE WITH HIP HOP ICON
In 1967, Jamaican-born DJ Kool Herc took the local sound system culture to the Bronx, New York and subsequently, Hip Hop was born. Four decades later, the genre has come full circle as Five Steez, one of Jamaica’s Hip Hop MCs, has collaborated with DJ Ready Cee, a New York underground Hip Hop radio icon from the Bronx, and released a mixtape online entitled ‘The Momentum: Volume One’.
The mixtape, which is the first release in a three part series, features 18 tracks, spanning a total of 46 minutes, in which Five Steez spits his lyrics over well-known instrumentals as DJ Ready Cee employs his tricks in mixing, cutting and scratching. It is available for download at www.djreadycee.com, www.facebook.com/fivesteez & iTunes.
“It’s been a while since I’ve heard a ‘real mixtape’ with actual mixing, plus scratching, and I wanted to bring that back,” says the rapper. “It’s become rare even within modern Hip Hop but this is what the mixtape is really about.”
DJ Ready Cee, known for The Underground Lockdown and The Ready Cee Show on New York City’s WHUT 91.9FM during the late 1990s and early 2000s, says, “I first heard the homie Five Steez when he sent me a track that I played on my online show. I was blown away and so were my co-hosts and listeners because it was so dope. And this kid is coming straight out of Kingston, Jamaica, so that was special.”
Five Steez says, “Ready Cee is an icon so it’s definitely an honour to get this type of support from him, particularly with the mixtape. I hope that this will highlight turntablism locally and also build my fanbase, especially abroad where the real market for Hip Hop exists.”
Five Steez is one of the most recognized artists within Kingston’s growing Hip Hop movement and is best known for his appearance in the music video, ‘Get Down’, and recent performances at Manifesto|Jamaica events, ART’ical Exposure and ART’ical Empowerment Live. He can be found at www.twitter.com/fivesteez (@FiveSteez) and www.facebook.com/fivesteez

item.title: THE MOMO SHOW! Every Monday Night At 8pm EST!
item.description: It's a gloomy, rainy day in The Rotten Apple; a perfect backdrop for the return of the world's most entertaining, yet most depressing program, THE MOMO SHOW. If you're an independent rap artist now is the time to send us your song & pic over to StreetVisionMedia@gmail.com for your chance to play on tonight's LIVE show.... THE MOMO begins at 8pm LIVE from NYC on http://streetvisionradio.com/ Check out the brand new show intro created by Jersey & Ben Bounce of 1221!

THE MOMO begins at 8pm LIVE from NYC on http://streetvisionradio.com/
Check out the brand new show intro created by Jersey & Ben Bounce of 1221!

item.title: AG - "We Do It"
item.description: Legendary Bronx MC, AG of Diggin In The Crates has just dropped another gem on the world of Hiphop in the form of DUNKIN DONUTS, a new mixtape lacing up all J-Dilla production! This is a snippet from the CD, a track titled, "We Do It". I had to throw this joint out here for yall because my dude AG gave me a real tight name drop in the verse... check it out here and be sure to grab the whole DUNKIN DONUTS mixtape today!

item.title: DJ READY CEE - R.I.P. GURU - ROUND 2
item.description: I went back in hard with another set for our brotha Guru! Spread this link around and let everyone hear this collection of joints from one of Hiphop's most important figures!

item.title: STREET VISION RADIO - EPISODE #3 : Special Guests : AG & SADAT X : PART 1
item.description: The Hiphop JUGGERNAUT that is STREET VISION RADIO is back with an epic episode for your listening enjoyment! This week, the legandary AG of DITC & SADAT X of BRAND NUBIAN join DJ READY CEE & DJ MIXX live from The Bronx!!! We get deep into the history and the future of these two legends and present exclusive new music from their collaborative project as well as their respected solo work! Be sure to download both parts this week, we've split the episode into 2 halves for your convenience! ENJOY!

item.title: STREET VISION RADIO - EPISODE #3 : Special Guests : AG & SADAT X : PART 2
item.description: The legendary episode continues in Part 2 with more from AG & SADAT X w/ DJ READY CEE & DJ MIXX! Sadat X got through the bottle of SMOKING LOON Merlot and now its on to the SPANISH QUARTER cabernet for our exclusive side episode of his popular YouTube series, TRUE WINE CONNOISSEUR! We keep the 1s 2s 3s & 4s spinnin' with timeless joints from both AG & Sadat X in the second hour so make sure you keep this one in your archives, its a classic!

item.title: THE READY CEE SHOW - EPISODE #150
item.description:
GOOD PEOPLE OF PLANET EARTH!

THE READY CEE SHOW RETURNS with Episode #150!! That's right people, we're back from vacation and it's time to put it down with a full hour of classics and blends just like we do every tenth episode. DJ Ready Cee and DJ Mixx have dug in the crates and given you yet another all-star mix of joints like you've never heard before! We're also celebrating DJ Ready Cee's birthday this week so drop a comment off and wish your favorite DJ a Happy B-Dizzle! Biggup goes out to everyone who's shown support over the years and everyone who voted for The Ready Cee Show for this year's 2009 Underground Music Awards, coming up on August 23rd at BB Kings in Times Square!
